reviews.review: Much worse then Fozen 1 but it still really good. Animation effects are amazing and songs of course are pretty nice.
loved the whole movie and my daughter really loved it. this is the first movie she had sat still and quiet for EVER in a movie theatre!

My wife and I took our granddaughter age 6-1/2 and grandson age 4-1/2 to see this movie.  Both of them had seen the original Frozen on video, but not in the theatre.  Our granddaughter loved the film, which worked at both a kids' and adult level--she was so thrilled that she literally danced in the aisles during the film's lengthy credits.  The themes of the film are decidedly adult:  It is important to learn the truth, and "do the next right thing."  For the kids, the movie was an adventure to turn on the lights and lift the clouds by going to a seemingly magical island--think Dora the Explorer with amazing graphics.  For adults, On the surface, there were no real "villians" in real time; the voyage involved understanding the past and making things right, which was surprising only because of the immediacy of those themes in present-day America.  It's Disney and it's G-rated, so you know the ending.  There are some scary moments for the little ones--my grandson wanted to sit on my lap, so be prepared.

Visually stunning. Songs weren't nearly as catchy (except for that "mysterious" tune that Elsa hears). Overall, a fine story but the screenplay was abysmal. Sure, it's a kids' movie, but the script is SO dumbed down. Incredibly simplistic. Somehow every character knows exactly what they need to do. 

Jennifer Lee is the most lucky person in Hollywood. Little talent and a billion dollars in the bank. We should all be so bad.

Kristoff's "80's-music-video" and Olaf's existential crises were great gags for adults, so why was the rest of the movie so puerile? Disappointing nothing-was-lost endings are Disney's forte, but this might be the worst of the worst.
It was a very good movie  my 4 year old granddaughter was mesmerized
thought it was kind of sexist didn't like how one of the sisters left Kristoff without even saying goodbye rude wouldn't want my son to date a woman like that
Loved it. Visually stunning and the plot had you on your toes. Loved the music!
It was super funny and a really great movie. Id definitely recommend it even though you think it will suck
